column1: Texas was then a vague and undetermined name in the minds of many. It might extend to the Rio Grande or it might extend only to the Nueces
column2: but to most the Rio Grande was the boundary between them and Mexico. So felt Ned and all his comrades. They were now on the soil which might own the overlordship of Mexico
column5: were spending their blood. It was strange what an attachment they had for it
column6: although not one of them was born there. Beyond
column8: there was much arguing about the right or wrong of their case
column9: but they knew that they would have to fight for their lives
column10: and for the homes they had built in the wilderness on the faith of promises that had been broken. That to them was the final answer and to people in such a position there could be no other.The sight of Texas

column13: and those rough frontiersmen in buckskin who rode with him were the very men whom he had chosen.
